message.content:
It is not exactly possible to stop producing oil on your face, as it is a natural process that helps keep your skin moisturized and protected. However, you can take steps to reduce excess oil production and manage oily skin:

1. Wash your face regularly: Use a gentle cleanser twice daily, in the morning and evening, to remove dirt and excess oil from your skin.

2. Choose the right products: Look for skincare products specifically formulated for oily or combination skin types. These often contain ingredients that help balance sebum production without over-drying the skin.

3. Exfoliate weekly: Use an exfoliating product once or twice per week to remove dead skin cells and unclog pores, which will help reduce excessive oiliness.

4. Avoid over-washing: Too much washing can strip away essential oils needed by the facial nerves; limit washing sessions if necessary.

5.Cancel out heavy makeup application with a matte finishing spray after everything has dried naturally on its surface instead of using powder compacts full time since clogged follicles could constrict vital blood flow underneath causing redness/inflammation leading towards breakouts resulting directly from compact pressed powders sitting atop open sore spots caused by said repeated rubbing action (i.e., retouching).
